headline: These Two Mining Stocks Perk Up As Lithium Prices Climb Higher
summary: Stocks of two lithium miners that have already delivered excellent gains this year passed early entry points on Tuesday.  Charlotte, N.C.-based Albemarle rose around 6%.  Meanwhile, Chilean miner Sociedad Quimica y Minera gained a little less than 4%.

headline: Albemarle: A Dividend Aristocrat Hanging on by a Lithium Thread
summary: Albemarle (NYSE: ALB) is a global leader in lithium production, supplying battery materials for electric vehicles and grid storage. After a prolonged downturn in lithium pricing, it is also paying dividends while losing money. That tension defines the entire dividend safety question. Albemarle Metric Value Annual Dividend $1.62 per share Dividend Yield ~1.0% Consecutive Years of Increases ... Albemarle: A Dividend Aristocrat Hanging on by a Lithium Thread
